dict.string: What best defines the reality outside a person's perception, according to Kabbalah?
Reality was there before you were born & will be there after you die
Reality changes according to your influence upon it
Reality is objective; your perception is subjective
There is no reality outside a person's perception
After a person receives information through his/her senses, where does that information get processed to create a picture of reality?
In the mind
In the heart
In the glandular system
In the nervous system
What defines the picture of reality a person perceives at any given moment?
Self-serving
Altruistic
Objective
Integral
What is the cause of a person's picture of reality?
The cause is unknown
Human nature is a will to receive pleasure for one's self-benefit
Nature is self-serving & the person is a part of nature
The Creator is self-serving & created man in His image
Where is the person with regard to reality?
The person is a tiny, irrelevant speck in reality
The stronger the person is, the more place s/he takes up in reality
The person is at the center of reality
The person doesn't exist in reality
What can a person change in reality?
Only oneself, i.e. one's perception of reality
Only reality itself
The person can change other people
The person can change him/herself & reality
Which of the following is NOT an implication of a person being at the center of reality?
That a person has nothing to change in reality other than his/her own self
The person has a great responsibility & role in reality
The person is insignificant in relation to the reality surrounding him/her
The whole of reality is inside the person
Which of the following is NOT a reason why we perceive reality as being outside ourselves?
In order for us to work to change ourselves, until we perceive reality entirely within
Because of the breaking of the vessels
In order to experience oppositeness from Nature & the need to re-unite with Nature
Because it was an error in the creation
Which of the following does NOT designate the shift from perceiving reality outside ourselves to perceiving reality within?
The quality of giving doesn't exist in us. The more we attain it, the more we perceive through it
Shifting from perceiving people & things to perceiving nothingness
Shifting from a corporeal perception to a spiritual one
Shifting from perceiving oneself as an individual/detached from others, to being completely connected to others and Nature
What is the name of the law that operates to bring us from perceiving reality outside ourselves, to perceiving reality within?
The law of conservation of mass
The law of equivalence of form
The law of conservation of energy
The law of attraction
